Bullshit matchmaking, especially if you decide to play as killer. You'll be matched with people in Rank 1. The people who've spent their life playing this game will bully you. If you are playing survivor then it's not that bad because probably someone else in your team will keep the killer busy by bullying him.

Definitely not recommended.

Honestly, I never leave reviews down but I think I would like to give everyone a head's up before they think about purchasing this game. 
I have played this game for quite awhile, maybe a couple of years (1.3k hours)? I always recommended this game because it was so much fun with the horror aspect. How it gave such a great impression when I started out, facing scary killers or unexpected abilities.
Now, I do not recommend it, and for me, my friends ALWAYS tell me that I am always playing DBD when I have free time. I know overtime, there were frustrations of "survivors or too OP" or "killers or too OP". Really, it came down whether to player themselves know how to utilize the max times as a survivor in looping and prioritizing situations in either healing, cleansing, or (first thing to do) do gens.
For a killer, probably whether they know how to mind game very well using their red stains and predicting survivor movements.

Now, it's just really survivor-sided. Personally, I didn't see it often but now the hit validation are so broken including dead hard. I could no, LEGIT, could not down a survivor when they were vaulting a pallet even though the hit registered on my end. It still gave me the hit cooldowns, so going against very good players, definitely game-breaking to win.

I see that killers are frustrated because when I played killer, a great amount of killers kept bringing in noed because they were at such a disadvantage that the game would drag on until end-game.

Also, yeah people say both sides are OP at one point, but this is such a survive with friends type of game which is about fun, trolling, and memeing at times.
But the game at this point, instead of fixing these bugs and ESPECIALLY the MMR, pretty much lost hope. I heard that Hellraiser had copyright issues where they collaborated with NFT (basically I believe something to do with black market or VERY SHADY business). Yet I still gave them the benefit of the doubt because maybe it was a mistake, but I don't believe that anymore.

DBD has been my main game for a couple of years and it's so sad to see I have this game into its shelf to find other games to play.
I know there are quite a bit of games that feature a 4 survivor and 1 killer games, so I'm starting to look elswhere as you should too.

I've been their frequent players where I even recommended MANY friends to come join in. Now that we're at this point, pretty much changed me to say to everyone. DON'T BUY OR PLAY IT ANYMORE.

Writing this review as of 1400+ hours sunk into the game. The game has changed a lot since I first started playing, and not in a good way.

What started as a fun "hide and seek" style game has since developed into "rush objectives and mock your opponent." The overall game play has sped up significantly, so if you're not rushing your objectives your falling behind. Slow to get gens done, and you'll find everyone on death hook before 2 gens have even finished. Likewise, as the killer if you don't hook enough survivors in the first 2 minutes and you'll find more then half the gens are done before the match even gets started.

Tactics have changed for the worse too. Survivors adapt fast builds to pump out gens and speed heal allies, while killers are camping more and tunneling down those they've already caught once before. Survivors that party together also use 3rd party voice chats like discord (when the lack of communication is part of the game play experience) to get a tactical advantage, leaving the killers to adapt to more ruthless camping/tunneling techniques to try and draw out those overly altruistic survivors and catch them as well.

This all in turn causes everyone to get mad at the other side, claiming they each have the shorter end of the stick. Now its almost impossible to play either side of the game without being hated just for trying to have fun. If your a survivor, killers just assume you part of a party, and thus must be punished. As a killer, its assumed your the worst of the worst and will be mocked in end game chat even if a single player escapes. Win or lose, rush objectives or enjoy the game, at the end of the day the only guarantee is that you will be mocked and bullied in the end game chat,
it gets boring fast.

I've had this game for a while now. I'm not much of a killer player, so I can't say much on that. Except, of course, that playing the killer is very relaxing. You're not getting chased by anyone!
On the survivor side of things, I enjoy playing this game a lot when it's with friends. We can be much better with strategy, keeping each apprised of what's going on, etc. Plus humor. That helps a lot. 
The only real buggy things I've dealt with have to be the huntress hitbox and the occasional blowup of the party (we've found you just have to close out of the game and reboot it). It's a fun game to chip away at just for the sake of playing. You can keep things fresh by switching up who you play or resetting character progress with prestige. There's always achievements and progressions and challenges to be had. It's a good game. 
By myself, it's still a pretty fun game. Just a little bit more scary.

Die Hitboxen sind ein absolutes verbrechen. Als Killer gegen ein starkes Fullteam keine Chance als normal Sterblicher. Es ist ein Witz, wie unballanciert diese spiel mittlerweile ist und wiiieee vvviiieeelllee Bugs es gibt. Sie bringen nur neuen Content ohne irgendetwas wichtiges zu Fixen. In meinen Augen sollten die Entwickler mal ausgewechselt werden, da sie wohl sehr Incompetent sind. Am liebsten würde ich jeden cent, denn ich in dieses spiel investuiert habe zurück nehmen und dafür v erwenden, Hasspost an die Entwickler zu schreiben. Würde mir mehr spaß machen, als diesen müll von tod bei tageslicht zu spielen. Also wie man unfreiwillig lesen kann, empfehle ich dieses spiel für menschen, die an einem Hirntod sterben wollen natürlich zutifst, doch für menschen die Spaß haben wollen, empfehle ich da eher ein spiel mit naja ein bisschen Balance. Also nicht dieses Drecks Game. Doch damit ist es nicht getan. Da ich letztens wider mal eine runde hatte mit Huntress, wo jedes beil in der luft stuck war. Habe ich mich dazu entschlossen, meine hand gefühlvoll aber mit großer kraft auf meinen tisch schlagen zu lassen. Damit wollte ich den punkt nur Verstärken,  wie dreckig dieses Game einfach ist. An reudigkeit nicht mehr zu überbieten. Da spiele ich lieber tanki online als diesen trash von Drecks Game. Euer treuer Tod bei tageslicht ( es gibt keine map wo tag ist) Hasser.

The game in itself is beautifully simple and effective. The tension caused by having to remain near something that makes light and noise while hiding from someone hunting you is the very definition of suspense. The community is a true mixed bag, from helpful and even funny killers to toxic players who ridicule newbies. All-in-all, I can't help but recommend this game. The polish and the adrenaline are addictive, and the progression advances smoothly and rewards hard work. Definitely worth your time. They could maybe cut back on the DLC though, I'm starting to think EA developed this game.

The game is balanced around low skill level survivors. Once your skill level is high as killer, survivors are the power roll and the killer is their plaything. Survivors can have more than four perks if one person runs a boon perk. There are other perks that work for the whole team but they're not as strong as boons. If you had trouble pressuring gens before, now you have another objective which is snuffing boons. If you don't snuff them you will lose survivors because they have no scratch marks and if you do snuff them you lose more gens. Lose lose. Using brain dead strategies likes camping, tunneling, and one shot perks/add-ons are encouraged because the skill cap for killer is very low. Furthermore, killers receive more nerfs if players can utilize their abilities and perks well. Survivor perks get buffed if not many people use them while killer perks get rendered useless if they give the slightest advantage. I've played a lot of survivor(i want to have fun from time to time and not sweat). I find that i never have to run many of the meta perks or builds because i can just abuse the killer's weaknesses. Even though getting in game currency is a grind for both roles you can still play well without strong survivor perks. I can't say the same about the killer role.
Probably in my top 5 games

Dead By Daylight es un juego de terror y supervivencia multijugador en el que 1 jugador interpreta el papel del asesino contra otros 4 jugadores, que son los supervivientes. El asesino debe matar y evitar que los supervivientes reparen los generadores que hayan en el mapa y escapen. Puede llegar a haber bastante diversión jugando como superviviente, donde también puedes jugar con amigos, que lo convierte en algo incluso más divertido. Se siente muy bien jugar como killer (aunque provoque el deseo de cortarse las arterias). La variedad de estos y de los supervivientes es algo MUY destacable del juego, ya que participan símbolos de terror propios de Behaviour Interactive y otros crossovers tan célebres y populares como Michael Myers y Laurie Strode (Halloween), Ghost Face (Scream), Freddy Krueger y Quentin Smith (Nightmare At Elm Street), Nemesis junto a Jill Valentine y Leon S. Kennedy (Resident Evil), Pinhead (Hellraiser), Pigsaw y el Detective Tapp (Saw), etcétera. 

Aparte de poder jugar como asesino y como superviviente, también puedes jugar con amigos en partidas de 5, en la que 1 de vosotros puede ser asesino contra los 4 demás; cosa que en matchmaking público no se puede hacer, ya que por troleo y juego sucio, la cola para jugar como supervivientes está limitada a 4 jugadores contra un asesino aleatorio. 

Las habilidades de asesinos y supervivientes están bastante bien, y le añaden mucho más jugo, objetivos y contenido al juego, cosa bastante importante.

El juego en si y el concepto es bastante interesante, sin embargo, se vuelve relativamente repetitivo en ocasiones: el hecho de tener que reparar generadores como superviviente y huir es muchas veces lo mismo, igual que como pasa con la tarea del asesino. A esto hay que añadirle los bugs y el GRAN desbalanceo de Dead By Daylight, junto con el mal matchmaking que no solo tarda mucho en ocasiones, sino que además te empareja con gente a muy claramente otro nivel. Estos son los mayores y más importantes errores de Dead By Daylight.

Aparte de eso, Dead By Daylight nos puede proporcionar muchísimas horas de diversión, y aunque parezca que tenga más ventajas que desventajas, este juego sigue siendo bastante bueno y tiene mucho que ofrecer.

Personalmente, creo que Dead By Daylight es un juegazo pero que hay bastantes problemas presentes, así que es un juego lejos de lo perfecto. Mi parte favorita del juego son los killers, sobretodo los killers invitados. También me gustaría que hubieran más skins para más cosas, en vez de tener un montón de amuletos estúpidos que no sirven para nada, por ejemplo podrían haber skins de objetos o habilidades de killers.

===[ASPECTOS NEGATIVOS Y POSITIVOS]===
🔴Negativos:
-Repetitividad.
-Desbalanceo tremendo.
-Matchmaking a veces lento y bastante nefasto.

🟢Positivos:
-Gran variedad de supervivientes, killers y legendarios personajes.
-Mucha diversión.

En resumen, un juego desequilibrado y repetitivo, aunque extremadamente entretenido que puede dar mucho vicio, sobretodo cuando se juega con amigos. Los crossovers y diferentes asesinos y supervivientes son una de las mejores cosas del juego. 8/10.
